MineralSite.name: NI 43-101 Technical Report for the Turnagain Project in North America dated June 2003.pdf

document.title: NI 43-101 Technical Report for the Turnagain Project in North America dated June 2003.pdf
document.description: A technical report on the Turnagain nickel property, which outlines the geological setting, mineralization, exploration history, and recommendations for future work.

deposit_type_candidate.observed_name: Nickel mineralization is associated with a zoned, Alaskan-type ultramafic complex within Paleozoic metasedimentary and metavolcanic rocks at the Turnagain property.

Iron and nickel sulphides, of magmatic origin, are hosted by peridotites and clinopyroxenites; the central dunite is devoid of sulphide minerals. Massive, semi-massive and sulphide matrix breccias have been noted in several surface showings and over restricted intervals in drill core.
Most of the nickel values are associated with sulphides rather than silicates and preliminary metallurgical test work suggests the potential for reasonably good recoveries of nickel and cobalt.

The Turnagain property represents a unique style of mineralization associated with a zoned, Alaskan-type ultramafic complex. Iron and nickel sulphides of magmatic origin are widespread in clinopyroxenites and peridotites bordering a non-mineralized dunite core.
